list_definition.definition: the book of accounts of an office or shop

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He made an entry in the ledger.

list_ex_of_english: These summaries were prepared from actual ledgers listing day-by-day transactions.
Most petitions were blank forms with ledgers for signatures, printed and distributed by farm journal editors.
Harding's work includes comprehensive references to military reports, packing lists, shipwrecks, inventories, expenditure ledgers and accounts receivable.
Once the cane was weighed, quantities were recorded in the mill's ledger.
If merchants' assiduous ledger-keeping reflects a need to establish a literary type of credit, their performance as trustworthy commercial actors suggests affinities with the theatre.
People registered next to each other in the ledgers lived next to each other in the town.
Wealth was a much broader matter than abstract figures in an accountant's ledger.
It thus quite clearly will improve his eventual moral ledger.
